pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8852144220/job/24310182386)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8852144220/job/24310182030)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8852144220/job/24310181829)
This looks pretty good to me. I left some comments.
This looks pretty good to me. I left some comments.

```suggestion
Also the instances finite + free => f.p. => finite are also provided
```

```suggestion
- `Module.FinitePresentation`: A module is finitely presented if it is generated by some
  finite set `s` and the kernel of the presentation `R  M` is also finitely generated.
```

```suggestion
For finitely presented algebras, see `Algebra.FinitePresentation` in file `RingTheory/FinitePresentation`.
```
Shouldn't code be indented two further spaces after `classical`? Looking through mathlib it seems that the vast majority of `classical`s have this property. Also on line 122.
`convert` followed by a bunch of tactics is sometimes a style which is hard to maintain. Is there a cheap way of avoiding the `convert`? If not then don't worry.
Can we write down the definition for semirings? Not that it really matters, but it should be doable for free.

```suggestion
    (hl : Function.Surjective l) (hl' : (LinearMap.ker l).FG) :
```
Does this work? Similarly below.
Are we missing a lemma here?
No. The goal is `(LinearMap.ker blah).FG` and there is `let  := blah` a few lines prior.

```suggestion
open BigOperators in
```
Or you can just really open it (it is repeated 3 times).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Finitely Presented Modules
